paper_title.en: Fabrication of SmFe12/α-Fe thin films as anisotropic nanocomposite magnet

description.en:
A series of nanocomposite thin films, composed of α-Fe and c-axis oriented SmFe12 phases, has been synthesized by rf magnetron sputtering onto heated glass substrates. The volume fraction of α-Fe, VFe, in the obtained films ranges from 5% to 85%. According to the Rietveld analysis of X-ray diffraction patterns, the c-axis of each SmFe 12 grain was estimated to locate within a cone with its symmetry axis being normal to the film plane and with the cone angle of 7°. For samples with VFe &lt
 30%, the demagnetization curves with fields applied normal to the film plane have exhibited a good squareness. In small VFe films, the coercivity Hc increased with increasing VFe, took a maximum for VFe ∼ 25%, and then decreased. In the reference system of randomly aligned SmFe12/α-Fe films, on the other hand, we confirmed that Hc decreased monotonically with increasing VFe. © 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Magnetic anisotropy in Sm2Fe17Nx (0 < x < 3) of intermediate nitrogen concentrations

description.en: The intermediate nitrogen content samples of Sm2Fe17Nx (0 < x < 3) were prepared by two steps nitriding method. The magnetization curves in the perpendicular direction to the particles alignment were measured by a high field (< 10T) magnetometer, and the curves of the intermediate regions were separated by numerical treatments for the analyses of K-1 coefficients of anisotropy using the Sucksmith-Thompson method. The border x value for the change in sign of K-1 coefficients from (-) to (+) was determined to be x = 0.9 at room temperature, x = 0.6 for 77 K and x = 0.4 for 4 K. The x value at room temperature corresponds to the nitrogen content at which a specific expansion in a-axis lattice constants was observed in the intermediate regions. The expansion results in the crystal electric field (CEF) variation, which can be calculated by the point charge model, that explains qualitatively the change in sign of the K-1 coefficients. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Fabrication of SmFe<SUP>12</SUP>/alpha-Fe thin films as anisotropic nanocomposite magnet
Fabrication and characterization of Co-Mn-Al Heusler-type thin film

description.en: Co-Mn-Al thin films were prepared using ultrahigh-vacuum magnetron sputtering on thermally oxidized silicon substrates at various substrate temperatures. Composition, crystal structure, magnetic property, and surface roughness of the films were investigated. The film prepared at a substrate temperature (T,) of around 300 degrees C had Co2MnAl B2 structure, revealing partial disorder between Mn and Al sites. Magnetization exhibited a maximum and coercive field exhibited a minimum around T-s=300 degrees C. Surface roughness increased with the substrate temperature. The film prepared at a substrate temperature of 300 degrees C was applied to a bottom electrode of a magnetic tunnel junction, thereby creating a large tunnel magnetoresistance. (c) 2005 American Institute of Physics.

paper_title.en: Fabrication and characterization of Co-Mn-Al Heusler-type thin film

paper_title.ja: Realization of anisotropic nanocomposite magnet in Nd<SUP>2</SUP>Fe<SUP>14</SUP>B / alpha-Fe thin films
paper_title.en: Realization of anisotropic nanocomposite magnet in Nd2Fe14B/alpha-Fe thin films

description.en: A series of Nd2Fe14B/α-Fe nanocomposite thin films, in which the crystallites of the Nd2Fe14B phase are well-oriented, has been synthesized by RF magnetron sputtering onto heated glass substrates. Magnetization curves exhibited single-phase-like hysteresis loops, suggesting that the two phases are firmly exchange-coupled. By comparing the observed magnetization curves with the micromagnetic calculations, we have estimated the intergrain exchange-coupling constants. © 2004 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS

paper_title.en: Realization of anisotropic nanocomposite magnet in Nd2Fe14B/alpha-Fe thin films

description.en: A series of Nd2Fe14B/α-Fe nanocomposite thin films, in which the crystallites of the Nd2Fe14B phase are well-oriented, has been synthesized by RF magnetron sputtering onto heated glass substrates. Magnetization curves exhibited single-phase-like hysteresis loops, suggesting that the two phases are firmly exchange-coupled. By comparing the observed magnetization curves with the micromagnetic calculations, we have estimated the intergrain exchange-coupling constants. © 2004 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS

paper_title.en: Fabrication and characterization of Co-Mn-Al Heusler-type thin film
Structure and magnetism in nanocrystalline Ca(La)B6 films

description.en: Nanocrystalline films of La-doped CaB6 have been fabricated by using a rf-magnetron sputtering. Lattice expansion of up to 6% with respect to the bulk value was observed along the direction perpendicular to the film plane, which arises from the trapping of Ar gas into the film. Large ferromagnetic moment of 3-4 μB/La has been observed in some La-doped films only when the lattice expansion rate is larger than 2.5%. © 2003 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Journal of Magnetism and Magnetic Materials

paper_title.en: Crystal-field-induced magnetostrictions in the spin reorientation process of Nd2Fe14B-type compounds

description.en: Volume expansion DeltaV/V associated with the spin reorientation process of Nd2Fe14B-type compounds has been investigated in terms of simple crystalline-electric-field (CEF) model. In this system, DeltaV/V is shown to be a direct measure of second-order CEF energy. Calculated anomalies in DeltaV/V associated with the first-order magnetization process of Nd2Fe14B are presented, which well reproduced the observations. (C) 2003 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS

paper_title.en: Structure and magnetism in nanocrystalline Ca(La)B-6 films

description.en: Nanocrystalline films of La-doped CaB6 have been fabricated by using a rf-magnetron sputtering. Lattice expansion of up to 6% with respect to the bulk value was observed along the direction perpendicular to the film plane, which arises from the trapping of Ar gas into the film. Large ferromagnetic moment of 3-4 mu(B)/La has been observed in some La-doped films only when the lattice expansion rate is larger than 2.5%. (C) 2003 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS

paper_title.en: Coercivity enhancements by high-magnetic-field annealing in sintered Nd-Fe-B magnets

description.en: An influence of a high-field annealing on the magnetic properties was investigated in sintered Nd-Fe-B magnets. When the sample B, containing 0.32 at. % Al, was annealed at T-a=550degreesC under a magnetic field of H-a=140 kOe and then cooled without field, the coercivity H-c increased by 25% with respect to the control sample annealed at zero field. As for the sample C, containing both Cu 0.13 at. % and Al 0.32 at. %, higher H-c values were obtained when it was annealed at T-a=550degreesC and the field of H-a=140 kOe was kept applied down to the room temperature. These results were discussed in terms of a field-induced change in interface matching between Nd2Fe14B and intergranular phases. (C) 2004 American Institute of Physics.

paper_title.en: Anisotropic lattice expansion and magnetism in sputter-deposited Ca(La)B-6 films

description.en: Nanocrystalline thin films of CaB6 and Ca0.995La0.005B6 were fabricated in this study using rf-magnetron sputtering. X-ray diffraction (XRD) measurements and scanning electron microscopy/energy dispersive spectrometer analyses revealed that lattice expansion of up to 6% with respect to the bulk value occurs along the direction perpendicular to the film plane. It is caused by the trapping of Ar gas into the film. On the other hand, in-plane XRD showed that spacing along the directions within the film plane is shrunk slightly. Large ferromagnetic moment of 0.01-0.02 mu(B)/f.u. was observed in some La-doped films only when the lattice expansion rate was larger than 2.5%. The Curie temperature was found to be markedly higher than 400 K.

paper_title.en: Anisotropic lattice expansion and magnetism in sputter-deposited Ca(La)B-6 films

description.en: Nanocrystalline thin films of CaB6 and Ca0.995La0.005B6 were fabricated in this study using rf-magnetron sputtering. Large ferromagnetic moment of 0.01-0.02 mu(B)/f.u. was observed in some La-doped films only when the lattice expansion rate was larger than 2.5%. The Curie temperature was found to be markedly higher than 400 K.
